intro: Drabella incana, commonly known as the hoary draba, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
